page.title: 18SOCIAL CONCERN CHELWOOD GATE
page.content: A Good Neighbour Scheme exists; organised by the Church to help those in need when they are ill or infirm. Meals-on-wheels are taken to the elderly. The lack of facilities for the young in the evening is of concern to parents. The inhabitants wish to keep the rural character of the village. There is great pressure, particularly from Gatwick Airport, to build more houses on avaiable plots - most of which are too expensive for local families who would like to remain here. There is great opposition to the expansion of the Red Lion pub, which would increase traffic, crowds, noise and litter in the area which is of Outstanding Natural Beauty.
